facts: The crankshaft in an engine turns the up-and-down motion of pistons into spinning motion that can move the vehicle.
A transmission changes gear ratios so the engine can work efficiently at different speeds, from starting out to cruising.
Disc brakes slow a vehicle when brake pads squeeze a spinning metal rotor, turning motion into heat.
Shock absorbers help keep tires on the road by reducing bouncing when the vehicle hits bumps.
A differential lets the left and right wheels spin at different speeds in a turn so the vehicle can corner smoothly.
The radiator helps prevent overheating by moving heat from hot engine coolant into the air.
The catalytic converter reduces harmful exhaust gases by using chemicals on its surface to change them into less harmful substances.
